greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = n^omega(n)/rad(n).
comment: a(n) = exp(-Sum_{d in P} moebius(d)*log(n/d)) where P = {d : d divides n and d is prime}. This is a variant of the (exponential of the) von Mangoldt function where the divisors are restricted to prime divisors. The (exponential of the) summatory function is A205957. Apart from n=1 the value is 1 if and only if n is prime; the fixed points are the products of two distinct primes (A006881).
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(n) = Product_{p|n} n/p. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Jun 27 2013
If n is squarefree, then a(n) = n^(omega(n)-1). - _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Jun 09 2020
a(p^e) = p^(e-1) for p prime, e > 0. - _Bernard Schott_, Jun 09 2020
mathematica: a[n_] := Exp[-Sum[ MoebiusMu[d]*Log[n/d], {d, FactorInteger[n][[All, 1]]}]]; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 68}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 15 2013 *)
program: return simplify(exp(-add(moebius(d)*log(n/d) for d in P)))
a205959 n = product $ map (div n) $ a027748_row n
results.author: _Peter Luschny_, Feb 03 2012
ext: New name from _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Jun 30 2013
